title: Space Force selects companies to develop concepts for simulated space war training range
summary: Nou Systems, ExoAnalytic Solutions, TMC Design, HII Mission Technologies Corp, Parsons Government Services Inc, and Lockheed Martin were awarded six-month study contracts.

title: NASA report identifies cost-effective approaches to dealing with orbital debris
summary: Decreasing the time satellites remain in orbit after the end of their missions is one of the most cost-effective ways to address the orbital debris problem, a NASA report concluded.

title: SpaceX breaks Falcon 9 flight record once more
summary: SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 for the 21st time on Friday with a launch from Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral...

title: DoD forecasts about $1.7 billion in commercial satcom buys over the coming year
summary: The largest projected contracts are for Marine Corps communications services and airborne satcom for senior leaders

title: How Artemis astronauts will be protected from solar storms
summary: Work is underway on new ways to protect Artemis astronauts from radiation and solar storms.

title: ESA selects Thales Alenia Space and The Exploration Company for commercial cargo program
summary: ESA has selected one of the continent’s largest space companies and one of its best-funded startups for study contracts that could lead to commercial cargo and crew vehicles.

title: Why are the Department of Defense and Space Force talking about buying foreign space technology?
summary: The United States Space Force Commercial Space Strategy reveals how the U.S. plans to leverage industry and European nations to keep pace with China

title: Beames is TrustPoint’s new executive chairman
summary: Beames also serves as executive chairman of the board for SpiderOak and small satellite manufacturer York Space Systems.

title: SpaceX launches NRO’s first batch of next-generation spy satellites
summary: The classified mission, designated NROL-146, was SpaceX’s 52nd launch of the year
